AboutIntro.title: About
AboutIntro.description: Data Scientist at PeopleTec | Computer Vision | Natural Language Processing | Adversarial AI | MS Computer Science 2024 | BS Mechanical Engineering 2018

About.about_paragraph: As a data scientist with experience in both computer vision and natural language processing, I have a proven track record of applying state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms to real-world problems. My background in mechanical engineering and current pursuit of a Master of Science in Computer Science from the Georgia Institute of Technology have equipped me with a unique skill set for tackling complex, interdisciplinary challenges. I have worked on projects ranging from object detection using TinyML, to adversarial AI and super resolution in computer vision. I am also an experienced software engineer, familiar with a variety of programming languages and development tools, and have presented my research at national and international machine learning conferences. My passion for solving problems through technology and drive for continual learning make me a strong asset to any team.

work_experience.title: Data Scientist
work_experience.description: Led research efforts in deep learning algorithms for satellite imagery for Object Detection,NLP, Adversarial AI, Dataset Creation, and other Computer Vision Tasks

work_experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer
work_experience.description: Developed Super-Resolution framework that increased precision (mAP) for various computer vision tasks by 15%

work_experience.title: Junior Engineer
work_experience.description: Developed fast, physics-based models for predicting damage and response of threat systems due to missile collisions

PapersIntro.title: Research
PapersIntro.description: A running history of my past research experience. Contains various topics including Image Classification, Object Detection, Natural Language Processing, Generative Adversarial Networks, Adversarial AI, Super Resolution and Game Agents.

latest_papers.title: Soft Labels for Satellite Object Detection
latest_papers.subtitle: Matthew Ciolino, Grant Rosario, David Noever
latest_papers.description: The paper examines the use of soft labels in satellite object detection using a YOLOv5 model on the xView dataset to detect cars, planes, and ships. Training on soft labels resulted in similar accuracy to the original dataset.
